remarks: Part of proof of Lemma G in [Crawley] p. 117, 4th line.  Whenever (in their terminology) p ` \/ ` q/0 (i.e. the sublattice from 0 to p ` \/ ` q) contains precisely three atoms and g is not the identity, g(p) = q. See also comments under ~ cdleme0nex .  (Contributed by NM, 8-May-2013.)
statement:
cdlemg12.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
cdlemg12.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
cdlemg12.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
cdlemg12.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
cdlemg12.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
cdlemg12.t $e |- T = ( ( LTrn ` K ) ` W ) $.
cdlemg12b.r $e |- R = ( ( trL ` K ) ` W ) $.
cdlemg17b $p |- ( ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( P e. A /\ -. P .<_ W ) /\ ( Q e. A /\ -. Q .<_ W ) ) /\ ( G e. T /\ P =/= Q ) /\ ( ( G ` P ) =/= P /\ ( R ` G ) .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) /\ -. E. r e. A ( -. r .<_ W /\ ( P .\/ r ) = ( Q .\/ r ) ) ) ) -> ( G ` P ) = Q ) $.
$d .<_ r $.
$d .\/ r $.
$d A r $.
$d G r $.
$d P r $.
$d Q r $.
$d W r $.
